image.altText: The Karratha Gas Plant

props.synopsis: Far from shoring up the state's gas supplies, industry analysts say the WA government's approach incentivises more exports.

title.children: Analysts warn household gas prices likely to rise as WA encourages more drilling

image.altText: The front gate of a medium security prison.

props.synopsis: The state's work safety watchdog will take the operator of Bunbury Regional Prison to court, claiming it failed to have systems in place to deal with allegations of sexual harassment and bullying.

title.children: WorkSafe to take justice department to court after alleged sexual harassment and bullying at WA prison

image.altText: Large yellow ant hill-like structures in yellow sand under a blue cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Western science has long debated when the towering pillars of the Pinnacles came to be. A new study suggests most of the spires formed when a particularly wet period dissolved the surrounding rock.

title.children: They may look like ant hills, but WA's Pinnacles are 100,000 years old, study suggests

image.altText: Smoke rises from the site of an Israeli airstrike in Dahiyeh, Beirut, Lebanon.

props.synopsis: The Lebanese health ministry says five people were killed and at least 11 injured in an Israeli raid targeting a district in the centre of Beirut, as Australia's foreign minister urges citizens to leave Lebanon.

title.children: Wong tells Australians 'do not wait' to leave as invasion escalates in Lebanon

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What to know about the Iran-backed 'Axis of Resistance'
China warns Middle East crisis 'hanging by a thread'
Lebanese factions revive bid to fill presidency as Israel attacks

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu chairs the weekly cabinet meeting.

props.synopsis: Israel's military spokesman made it clear: Iran would face "consequences" for the barrage of missiles it sent on Tuesday night. This is what some of those could look like.

title.children: Israel has promised Iran 'consequences'. Here are three things that could happen next

image.altText: A performer in Song Circle on the moving sand stage

props.synopsis: The Noongar season of Kambarang in south-west WA is set to begin with five days of song, dance and music designed to promote joy and healing.

title.children: Joyful celebration of Noongar culture to mark the return of flowers and warm weather

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of a man standing in court wearing a blue face mask.

props.synopsis: A man who broke into the bedroom of a seven-year-old, taped her mouth shut and choked her unconscious before sexually assaulting her is found guilty by a Perth judge.

title.children: Man found guilty of choking, raping child in Perth home with judge rejecting mental impairment defence

image.altText: A woman with grey hair sits in a chair in a house, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: Days before Christmas, Maurine's retirement village threatened her with eviction. Advocates say village operators have an incentive to churn residents to maximise revenue from exit fees.

title.children: The tactics retirement villages use to churn residents and maximise profits

image.altText: comet trevor dobson

props.synopsis: Described as one of the brightest comets in recent years, it could return looking even more impressive later this month if it survives a close call with the sun.

title.children: 'Amazing' comet puts on a show in Australian skies for astrophotographers

image.altText: Tony Armstrong wearing a white T shirt and a denim jacket.

props.synopsis: Barely 24 hours after the ABC committed to a suite of actions to stamp out racism experienced by their First Nations and culturally and linguistically diverse staff, the broadcaster's Director News was again publicly calling it out.

title.children: Trolling of Tony Armstrong shows exactly why action is needed to stamp out racism at the ABC and beyond

image.altText: A campaign placard.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris needs to win Michigan, but the Republican strategy to swing the state is stronger than you might think.

title.children: 'They will vote Trump': The troubling signs for Democrats in a state Kamala Harris must win

image.altText: A mobile screen with a blurred image of a person

props.synopsis: The federal opposition has called for urgent action to prevent the personal data of Australia's national security personnel being on-sold to foreign actors after a new report exposed a blackmail risk.

title.children: Your sensitive personal data is shared almost 500 times a day by the online ad industry

image.altText: Tim Walz and JD Vance stand behind podiums on a TV studio floor.

props.synopsis: The vice-presidential debate might have been JD Vance's best moment since he became the nominee. It also helped show how he could be the post-Trump future of MAGA.

title.children: JD Vance may have cemented himself as the post-Trump future of MAGA

image.altText: Donald Trump purses his lips as he stands in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Donald Trump laid the groundwork to try overturn the 2020 election even before he lost, knowingly pushed false claims of voter fraud, and "resorted to crimes" in his failed bid to cling to power, according to a newly unsealed court filing.

title.children: 'Resorted to crimes': Court filing reveals new details of Trump's attempt to overturn 2020 election

image.altText: A bronze statue of a man. Its head is missing.

props.synopsis: Charges against Timothy Walker, accused of removing the head of the statue of Kalgoorlie pioneer Paddy Hannan, have been dropped and the earlier conviction of Damien Wesley can now be revealed.

title.children: Bizarre statue beheading case concludes with a conviction and an acquittal

image.altText: A black and white close up of a woman's face.

props.synopsis: Some are concerned banning young people from social media could prevent marginalised people from finding "life-saving" resources they may not be able to access offline.

title.children: Marginalised young people say social media ban would cut off a key lifeline

image.altText: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Iran's 'Axis of Resistance' are dedicated to countering US and Israeli influence in the Middle East. Here's a look at the group's key players and their roles in the current conflict.

title.children: What is Iran's so-called Axis of Resistance?

image.altText: A young girl crouches on the ground wearing a pink jumper and beanie, smiling

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been imprisoned after the buggy he was driving with seven children on board flipped and killed his daughter's friend in 2021.

title.children: Man jailed for five years over farm buggy rollover that killed 6yo family friend

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: There are still some areas where the prime minister and the opposition leader are roughly on the same page, but within those broad areas of agreement lies an intensifying blame game over who's endangering national security here in Australia.

title.children: Amid the heated debate over the Middle East, a private meeting between Dutton and Albanese took place

image.altText: Bill Shorten press gallery doorstop

props.synopsis: National Disability Insurance Scheme Minister Bill Shorten rebuffs criticism that participants were given less than 48 hours' notice about crucial changes to items that can be funded by the scheme.

title.children: Big NDIS changes come into effect today, including a highly contentious list

image.altText: An empty supermarket aisle.

props.synopsis: Ever noticed more air and less chips in a packet, even though it's being sold for the same price? The federal government says it has a plan to tackle "shrinkflation" by setting stricter rules around pricing.

title.children: 'Shrinkflation' is lightening your shopping trolley while you pay the same price. The government wants to redo pricing rules

image.altText: Karrakatta Norfolk chapel fire damage

props.synopsis: A woman accused of starting a blaze which gutted Perth's largest cemetery chapel overnight is also responsible for another cemetery fire last week, police allege.

title.children: Woman charged after second suspicious fire at a Perth cemetery in less than week causes $1 million damage

image.altText: A girl looking at her phone

props.synopsis: Young people say racist commentary on social media makes them feel unsafe, as a report calls for a systemic overhaul to address the rampant racism experienced by young Territorians.

title.children: Cruel vitriol on Alice Springs social media pages leaves young people feeling frightened and vulnerable

image.altText: Mine conveyor belt sprays coal in the air into a pile dug from a mine at Oaky Creek near Middlemount in central Qld

props.synopsis: Operations at the Oaky Creek Coal Mine have been suspended in the wake of Queensland's fourth mining worker death this year and the union is asking questions about safety in the industry.

title.children: Union demands answers following fourth Queensland coal mine death this year

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading flat on Thursday afternoon, following Wall Street's lead as investors monitor developments in the Middle East. Follow live.

title.children: ASX steady after Wall Street ends flat, Origin Energy abandons its hydrogen plans

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Origin Energy drops Hunter Valley hydrogen plans
European Union eyeing EV import tariffs on China

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has yet to confirm how many jobs will be lost nor who will be impacted, but confirmed a major restructure would take place.

title.children: ANU to cut jobs and spending as it faces $200 million deficit

image.altText: Lady Gaga looks at Joaquin Phoenix in a scene from Joker: Folie À Deux.

props.synopsis: The Joker sequel is a quasi-musical courtroom drama that has little interest in advancing any kind of story. In fact, it's even more deliberately obtuse and anti-crowd-pleasing than its predecessor.

title.children: Joker sparked a cultural meltdown and won its star an Oscar. Will the sequel, with Lady Gaga, do the same?

image.altText: Thumbnail Metricon licence_02

props.synopsis: More than a year after NSW Fair Trading began its investigation into Metricon, senior staff of the home builder have been ordered to sit a three-day, $2,250-per-person course.

title.children: Senior staff at Australia's biggest home builder ordered to sit basic training by regulator

image.altText: Houses lining a suburban street

props.synopsis: Help-to-buy schemes were a "useful ingredient" to ease the housing crisis but needed to be teamed with tax reform, the Australian Institute of Housing and Urban Research managing director said.

title.children: Now the 'Help to Buy' bill is returning to parliament, here's how shared equity works for first home buyers

image.altText: Jaclyn Narracott smiles holding a medal

props.synopsis: Skeleton racer Jaclyn Narracott achieved her Olympic dream "on the smell of an oily rag", but has "nothing left" as she bows out of the sport an "Australian winter sport trailblazer".

title.children: 'Remarkable human' Jaclyn Narracott, Australia's first Olympic skeleton medallist, retires

image.altText: Luisa Sergio, Humpty Doo resident gets the Pfizer vaccine

props.synopsis: A $54 billion pitch for clinics staffed with free general practitioners, dentists and psychologists, higher bulk-billing rates and improved trainee doctor pay will be a central plank of the Greens' election campaign — and a key point in negotiations if Labor is forced to deal with the Greens to form government.

title.children: Greens launch election pitch for 1,000 free GP clinics, to be a key bargaining chip if Labor is forced into minority government

image.altText: Holly from Fat Bear Week

props.synopsis: With Alaska's bears fat, fluffy and stuffed full of salmon, Fat Bear Week is upon us.

title.children: The internet's beloved Fat Bear Week returns after deadly attack delayed reveal
